1604067689_mirrored_Noruka_github.body:
My /opt/zeronet/src/Config.py has no getCmdlineValue method and my zeronet version is [0.7.1-1](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/zeronet/)
```
self.version = "0.7.0"
self.rev = 4206
```

Seems not like an OS problem, but I am using the latest arch linux

My `journalctl -xe` output
```
Jan 14 17:24:04 archer zeronet[13806]: [17:24:04] - Libsecpk256k1 loaded: CompiledLib in 1.170s
Jan 14 17:24:05 archer zeronet[13806]: [17:24:05] - Unhandled exception: 'ConfigPlugin' object has no attribute 'getCmdlineValue'
Jan 14 17:24:05 archer zeronet[13806]: Traceback (most recent call last):

Jan 14 17:24:05 archer zeronet[13806]:   File "/opt/zeronet/src/Config.py", line 464, in loadPlugins

Jan 14 17:24:05 archer zeronet[13806]:     return super(ConfigPlugin, self).createArguments()
Jan 14 17:24:05 archer zeronet[13806]:   File "/opt/zeronet/plugins/Bigfile/BigfilePlugin.py", line 791, in createArguments
Jan 14 17:24:05 archer zeronet[13806]:     return super(ConfigPlugin, self).createArguments()
Jan 14 17:24:05 archer zeronet[13806]:   File "/opt/zeronet/plugins/Benchmark/BenchmarkPlugin.py", line 347, in createArguments
Jan 14 17:24:05 archer zeronet[13806]:     if self.getCmdlineValue("test") == "benchmark":
Jan 14 17:24:05 archer zeronet[13806]: AttributeError: 'ConfigPlugin' object has no attribute 'getCmdlineValue'
```

EDIT: Even after removing /opt/zeronet and reinstalling, the Config.py file is still the same with no getCmdlineValue method. However I've found another Config.py in my data_dir  `/var/lib/zeronet/1uPDaT3uSyWAPdCv1WkMb5hBQjWSNNACf/core/src/Config.py` that:
- has the getCmdlineValue method in line 465
- self.version = "0.7.1"
- self.rev = 4325

I don't know if it is safe to move the second Config.py to /opt/zeronet/src/Config.py but I just did it and the log shows a successful start.
